title: Ethiopian PM issues 72-hour deadline for Tigrayan forces to surrender
description: After weeks of deadly conflict in Ethiopia's northern Tigray region, Ethiopian Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed has given Tigrayan forces a 72-hour deadline to surrender.

title: CNN anchor: Trump's claims are a joke but judges aren't laughing
description: President Trump and his legal team have lost or withdrawn at least 30 cases in their effort to overturn the 2020 presidential election results. CNN's Jake Tapper discusses.

title: Governor invokes dad's stand against Nixon, calls out GOP
description: Republican Maryland Governor Larry Hogan's father was the first Republican to break with the GOP and support President Nixon's impeachment. Now he's one of only a few Republicans to publicly acknowledge Joe Biden's win and call for President Trump to concede.

title: Bolton: GOP needs to look out for the party, not Trump
description: Former national security adviser John Bolton speaks with CNN's Jake Tapper about what the Republican party will look like following Trump's presidency.

title: US swimmer Caeleb Dressel breaks two world records in one hour
description: Weekends are times when some people struggle for motivation. Caeleb Dressel apparently has no such issues.

title: US formally withdraws from Open Skies Treaty that bolstered European security
description: The US is expected to announce on Sunday that it will formally exit the decades-old Open Skies Treaty, some six months after President Donald Trump first announced the decision, according to multiple US officials.

title: Canadian officials warn drivers not to let moose lick their cars
description: Canadians, officials have an important message for you: "Do not let moose lick your car."

title: China is launching a space mission to collect the first rocks from the moon in 40 years
description: China plans to launch an unmanned spacecraft to the moon this week to bring back lunar rocks -- the first attempt by any nation to retrieve samples from Earth's natural satellite since the 1970s.

title: The President and his opportunistic enablers are injecting doubt -- and anxiety -- wherever they can. The returns, though, seem to be diminishing.
description: President Donald Trump's attempts to overturn his election loss are plunging deeper into incoherence.

title: Georgia: Trump campaign requests recount that's unlikely to change his loss in the state
Refugees flee Ethiopia massacre and join tens of thousands travelling to Sudan
description: • Several injured in airstrikes on Tigray capital, humanitarian source says

title: Amazon is already running Black Friday sales on Ring, Echo, and Fire TV devices
description: Black Friday is still a week out. But as we've seen year after year, deals start before anyone's even begun cooking their Turkey.

title: US coronavirus cases top 12 million. An expert says spread is now 'faster' and 'broader' than ever
The much-hyped Hong Kong-Singapore 'travel bubble' is postponed amid Covid-19 spike
Biden's mistake about Trump
description: Joe Biden is making a mistake.

title: Pennsylvania: Federal judge dismisses Trump campaign lawsuit
The history of Macy's Thanksgiving Parade: 5 things you may not know
description: Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade has been a tradition for decades -- not only for New York City but for a TV-watching nation as well. And it's amassed quite an interesting history in that time.

title: Judge rules Voice of America head curbed First Amendment rights of its journalists
description: The chief executive of the agency that oversees Voice of America and his team must stop investigating and interfering with the journalists employed there, a federal judge ruled Friday.

title: Nevada: Judge denies request to halt state certification of results
Trump tweets about election results and skips session on pandemic during G20
description: President Donald Trump participated in his final Group of 20 summit on Saturday by tweeting throughout the opening session and skipping a special side-conference focused on the coronavirus pandemic.

title: The only way Republicans can lead again
description: President Donald Trump is conducting an all-out assault on our democracy. There is no other way to look at this. The President lost the election and his legal team has failed to produce evidence of voter fraud. So now President Trump is attempting to convince state legislatures to overthrow the results. Voters made their decision, and yet he wants to force a different outcome. His attorney, Rudy Giuliani, is spewing the kinds of conspiracy theories that even conspiracy theorists shy away from. This is dangerous stuff. When some writers, such as Barton Gellman, writing in the Atlantic,  predicted this would happen, too many people shrugged off the warning.
